page.title: 10THE RIVER EXE
page.content: At this point the valley is a conservation area and nature sanctuary.A variety of deciduous hardwoods are found.Many younger trees have been planted with many alder along the actual river and leat.A line of 176 lombardy poplars along the perimeter of the University playing fields is undergrown with many hazel, chestnut,hawthorn and lime.Many wild flowers are seen throughout the year. The river is tidal as far as Salmon Pool Weir where sea fish are caught. There is a salmon ladder on the west side of the weir. Leach's Pond is a sheltered pond below the tidal point where we caught a variety of creatures.The leat flowing through the pond has several derelict mills,the oldest one being a grist (flour) mill.The mill workers cottages are still inhabited after 150 years.
